intro: Oxyotis sedoides, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Oxyotis sedoides is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
